comments.body: @olafurpg This is potentially controversial, but we don't provide any [compatibility guarantees](https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/blob/master/COMPATIBILITY.md) for the file layout.

Review of our tools:
  * `semanticdb-scala` [already does the same](https://github.com/scalameta/semanticdb-sbt/blob/master/sbthost/nsc/src/main/scala/scala/meta/internal/sbthost/ConfigOps.scala#L10).
  * `scalafix` [uses Database.load](https://github.com/scalacenter/scalafix/blob/master/scalafix-cli/src/main/scala/scalafix/cli/CliRunner.scala#L345), which in turn [calls v.Database.toSchema](https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/blob/master/langmeta/langmeta/shared/src/main/scala/org/langmeta/semanticdb/Database.scala#L47), which [doesn't care about on-disk filenames](https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/blob/master/langmeta/langmeta/shared/src/main/scala/org/langmeta/semanticdb/internal/vfs/Database.scala#L22) as long as [they end with "semanticdb"](https://github.com/scalameta/scalameta/blob/master/langmeta/langmeta/shared/src/main/scala/org/langmeta/semanticdb/internal/vfs/SemanticdbPaths.scala#L13).
  * `metadoc` already does the same (multiple links don't fit here).
  * `metals` doesn't care about filenames at all as long as the file ends with `.semanticdb`.
Just do it. I don't rely on the filenames because the URI is embedded in the proto message

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +21,25 @@  """.getBytes(UTF_8))
  val target = Files.createTempDirectory("target_")
  val helloWorldSemanticdb = target.resolve("META-INF/semanticdb/HelloWorld.scala.semanticdb")

  test("metac " + helloWorldScala) {

comments.body: @olafurpg In this pull request, I've finally upstreamed my personal helper tools: `metac` (compile Scala files into SemanticDB) and `metap` (decompile SemanticDB files). See this test suite for an example of how these tools work.
line/column is arguably more pleasant to read üëç
